flawed_nl_solution:
Out of 100 students, half are girls and half are boys so there are 100/2 = <<100/2=50>>50 girls
There are 50 girls out of 100 students means there are 100-50 = <<100-50=50>>50 boys
20% of the 50 girls have dogs so they have 0.2*50 = <<20*0.01*50=10>>10 dogs
10% of the 50 boys have dogs so they have 0.1*50 = <<0.1*50=5>>5 dogs
The girls have 10 dogs and the boys have 5 dogs so together, they have 10+5 = <<10+5=12>>12 dogs
#### 12

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 12. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
